channel.title: Client can connect to my computers internal IP but not the public IP
channel.description:
Subject says the problem, now how do i fix this? I am using insidiaX
and Yes i did port forward and everything correctly, and by internal IP I don't mean the 127.0.0.1, but the IP that you assign a port to in your routers portforward menu

item.title: Client can connect to my computers internal IP but not the public IP
item.dc:creator: @Kayceee Kayceee
item.description:
@Kayceee wrote:

Have you got a firewall or using a proxy that might be blocking the connection?
try pinging the IP and see if it resolves to anything…

Read full topic

item.title: Client can connect to my computers internal IP but not the public IP
item.dc:creator: @Gr3nwr35stlr Gr3nwr35stlr
item.description:
@Gr3nwr35stlr wrote:

OK thank you for checking. And no I am not trying to advertise in any way, in fact I don’t even want people to play my server right now, just one of my friends.

item.title: Client can connect to my computers internal IP but not the public IP

Im pretty sure that count as a adv.

btw it worked.

item.title: Client can connect to my computers internal IP but not the public IP
item.dc:creator: @Chaotic-land Chaotic-land
item.description:
@Chaotic-land wrote:

]Its just 5 simple steps :eek:

[shadow=red,left]1.portforward.
2.dowload no-ip.
3.make a host.
4.run the no-ip.
5.change the client ip.
6.Compile[/shadow]

item.title: Client can connect to my computers internal IP but not the public IP
item.dc:creator: @Gr3nwr35stlr Gr3nwr35stlr
item.description:
@Gr3nwr35stlr wrote:

yes, when i change it to my computers internal IP that is assigned by the router it works, but when i use the public IP it doesnt work. This one small thing is so frustrating, i have so many things i want to work on with this server lol
